channel.title: One Square Meter
channel.description: A year-long biodiversity documetation of 1m² area in Gundmi, India.

item.title: Sighting: Grass Moth
item.description:
Grass Moth (Crambidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

I am so not sure what species, family, order, etc etc.

Weather: 28.5°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Leaf Miner Moth
item.description:
Leaf Miner Moth (Lepidoptera)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Very small, looks like a tiny twig.

Weather: 28.5°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Carpenter Ant
item.description:
Carpenter Ant (Camponotus Parius)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Communication, ant style.

Weather: 28.5°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Parasitoid Wasp
item.description:
Parasitoid Wasp (Platygastridae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

These are very small. Takes a lot of patience.

Weather: 28.5°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Weevil
item.description:
Weevil (Curculionidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

insect

Weather: 28.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Damselfly
item.description:
Damselfly (Agriocnemis pygmaea)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Dame is here! What a beauty!

Weather: 28.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Ant-mimicking Jumping Spider
item.description:
Ant-mimicking Jumping Spider (Myrmarachne Sp.)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

At first, I fell for it. I thought it is the carpenter ant. But it wasn't moving around, unlike the other ants near by. Hah! It figured the mimicking part really well, but didn't copy the behaviour. I got him!

Weather: 28.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Velvet Ant
item.description:
Velvet Ant (Dasymutilla quadriguttata)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Like many ants in the patch, this kept moving along each grass blade, leaves. Tiny one.

Weather: 28.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Black Scavenger Fly
item.description:
Black Scavenger Fly (Sepsidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

It has funny walk. Keeps flapping its wings every few steps.

Weather: 28.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Parasitoid Wasp
item.description:
Parasitoid Wasp (Braconidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Not sure of the identification. I couldn't get more than one angle of this.

Weather: 29.8°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Long Legged Fly
item.description:
Long Legged Fly (Dolichopodidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

What is with these metallic green shiny bugs! Quite a few around here.

Weather: 29.8°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Darkling Beetle
item.description:
Darkling Beetle (Tenebrionidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

This one allowed me click just 2 photos, lucky me.

Weather: 29.8°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Rainbow Bee
item.description:
Rainbow Bee (Nomia Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

So tiny! like about 1.2 mm may be. I am not sure of the ID.

Weather: 29.8°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Nomad Bee
item.description:
Nomad Bee (Nomada Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

This one allowed me take a quite a few snaps. Eventually landed where in the sunshine!

Weather: 29.8°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Bee Fly
item.description:
Bee Fly (Bombyliidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Not very sure of the identification. I think I have done many mistakes already. This one looks like a mosquito, but bee apparently. How.

Weather: 29.8°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Sword-tail Cricket
item.description:
Sword-tail Cricket (Trigonidium cicindeloides)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Crickets are cool, they sit still.

Weather: 29.6°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Planthopper
item.description:
Planthopper (Metadelphax propinqua)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Look at the details on it. It is very small, hard to spot.

Weather: 29.6°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Green Lacewing Larva
item.description:
Green Lacewing Larva (Chrysopidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

This time it is carrying trash! Also known as trash bug.

Weather: 29.6°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Jumping Spider
item.description:
Jumping Spider (Salticidae Sp.)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

I casually took the picture of the flower, only to see the tiniest of the spiders! Very gool guy. He was quite busy.

Weather: 29.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Green Lacewing Larva
item.description:
Green Lacewing Larva (Chrysopidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

I saw a blob of cotton walking around! Reminded me of Howl's castle. Cool bug!

Weather: 29.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Week 1: Not bad!
item.description:
My knees hurt.

Hello!

So, end of the week (well, just 4 days)! 20 species found, from very tiny to slightly bigger ones!

I saw 3 new hoppers that I hadn't seen before. They are tiny!

So, the morning light is not enough to get good quality photos, I have to bump up ISO, which leads to very grainy images. Looks like I will spend monies on a flash. Sigh.

My macro photography skills have rusted. I am hoping it will get better as the time goes on.

I also discoverd a very similar project done before by Chris Helzer. Read about it here. The photographs he has taken are very clean and precise! Now I have a benchmark to aim for!

One week at a time!

item.title: Day one!
item.description:
So it begins.

Hello world!

Welcome to a square meter project, here we like bugs. Find more about the project in the about section.

Today, I set up the fence posts on 4 corners of the patch, cleaned up the space a bit, placed an old wood piece in it. That is it. No more fiddling with the patch for the rest of the year.

My first immediate dilemma is this:

If I spot a bug within the square meter but it moves out of the boundary before I can get a photo, should I still take the picture and count it as a sighting, or should I let it go?
